046/**
047 * Deprecated - please migrate to <code>io.ebean.DatabaseConfig</code>.
048 *
049 * The configuration used for creating a Database.
050 * <p>
051 * Used to programmatically construct a Database and optionally register it
052 * with the DB singleton.
053 * </p>
054 * <p>
055 * If you just use DB without this programmatic configuration DB will read
056 * the application.properties file and take the configuration from there. This usually
057 * includes searching the class path and automatically registering any entity
058 * classes and listeners etc.
059 * </p>
060 * <pre>{@code
061 *
062 * ServerConfig config = new ServerConfig();
063 *
064 * // read the ebean.properties and load
065 * // those settings into this serverConfig object
066 * config.loadFromProperties();
067 *
068 * // explicitly register the entity beans to avoid classpath scanning
069 * config.addClass(Customer.class);
070 * config.addClass(User.class);
071 *
072 * Database database = DatabaseFactory.create(config);
073 *
074 * }</pre>
075 *
076 * <p>
077 * Note that ServerConfigProvider provides a standard Java ServiceLoader mechanism that can
078 * be used to apply configuration to the ServerConfig.
079 * </p>
080 *
081 * @author emcgreal
082 * @author rbygrave
083 * @see DatabaseFactory
084 */
085@Deprecated
086public class ServerConfig {
087
088  /**
089   * The Database name.
090   */
091  private String name = "db";
092
093  /**
094   * Typically configuration type objects that are passed by this ServerConfig
095   * to plugins. For example - IgniteConfiguration passed to Ignite plugin.
096   */
097  private Map<String, Object> serviceObject = new HashMap<>();
098
099  private ContainerConfig containerConfig;
100
101  /**
102   * The underlying properties that were used during configuration.
103   */
104  private Properties properties;
105
106  /**
107   * The resource directory.
108   */
109  private String resourceDirectory;
110

112   * Set to true to register this Database with the DB singleton.

117   * Set to true if this is the default/primary database.

138  /**
139   * When true will load entity classes via ModuleInfoLoader.
140   * <p>
141   * NB: ModuleInfoLoader implementations are generated by querybean generator.
142   * Having this on and registering entity classes means we don't need to manually
143   * write that code or use classpath scanning to find entity classes.
144   */
145  private boolean loadModuleInfo = true;

592  /**
593   * Put a service object into configuration such that it can be passed to a plugin.
594   * <p>
595   * For example, put IgniteConfiguration in to be passed to the Ignite plugin.
596   * </p>
597   */
598  public void putServiceObject(String key, Object configObject) {
599    serviceObject.put(key, configObject);
600  }
601
602  /**
603   * Return the service object given the key.
604   */
605  public Object getServiceObject(String key) {
606    return serviceObject.get(key);
607  }
608
609  /**
610   * Put a service object into configuration such that it can be passed to a plugin.
611   *
612   * <pre>{@code
613   *
614   *   JedisPool jedisPool = ..
615   *
616   *   serverConfig.putServiceObject(jedisPool);
617   *
618   * }</pre>
619   */
620  public void putServiceObject(Object configObject) {
621    String key = serviceObjectKey(configObject);
622    serviceObject.put(key, configObject);
623  }
624
625  private String serviceObjectKey(Object configObject) {
626    return serviceObjectKey(configObject.getClass());
627  }
628
629  private String serviceObjectKey(Class<?> cls) {
630    String simpleName = cls.getSimpleName();
631    return Character.toLowerCase(simpleName.charAt(0)) + simpleName.substring(1);
632  }
633
634  /**
635   * Used by plugins to obtain service objects.
636   *
637   * <pre>{@code
638   *
639   *   JedisPool jedisPool = serverConfig.getServiceObject(JedisPool.class);
640   *
641   * }</pre>
642   *
643   * @param cls The type of the service object to obtain
644   * @return The service object given the class type
645   */
646  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
647  public <P> P getServiceObject(Class<P> cls) {
648    return (P) serviceObject.get(serviceObjectKey(cls));
649  }
650
651  /**
652   * Return the Jackson JsonFactory to use.
653   * <p>
654   * If not set a default implementation will be used.
655   */
656  public JsonFactory getJsonFactory() {
657    return jsonFactory;
658  }

666    this.jsonFactory = jsonFactory;
667  }

728  /**
729   * Return the container / clustering configuration.
730   * <p/>
731   * The container holds all the Database instances and provides clustering communication
732   * services to all the Database instances.
733   */
734  public ContainerConfig getContainerConfig() {
735    return containerConfig;
736  }
737
738  /**
739   * Set the container / clustering configuration.
740   * <p/>
741   * The container holds all the Database instances and provides clustering communication
742   * services to all the Database instances.
743   */
744  public void setContainerConfig(ContainerConfig containerConfig) {
745    this.containerConfig = containerConfig;
746  }

748  /**
749   * Return true if this server should be registered with the Ebean singleton
750   * when it is created.
751   * <p>
752   * By default this is set to true.
753   * </p>
754   */
755  public boolean isRegister() {
756    return register;
757  }
758
759  /**
760   * Set to false if you do not want this server to be registered with the Ebean
761   * singleton when it is created.
762   * <p>
763   * By default this is set to true.
764   * </p>
765   */
766  public void setRegister(boolean register) {
767    this.register = register;
768  }
769
770  /**
771   * Return true if this server should be registered as the "default" server
772   * with the Ebean singleton.
773   * <p>
774   * This is only used when {@link #setRegister(boolean)} is also true.
775   * </p>
776   */
777  public boolean isDefaultServer() {
778    return defaultServer;
779  }
780
781  /**
782   * Set false if you do not want this Database to be registered as the "default" database
783   * with the DB singleton.
784   * <p>
785   * This is only used when {@link #setRegister(boolean)} is also true.
786   * </p>
787   */
788  public void setDefaultServer(boolean defaultServer) {
789    this.defaultServer = defaultServer;
790  }

892  /**
893   * Return the PersistBatch mode to use by default at the transaction level.
894   * <p>
895   * When INSERT or ALL is used then save(), delete() etc do not execute immediately but instead go into
896   * a JDBC batch execute buffer that is flushed. The buffer is flushed if a query is executed, transaction ends
897   * or the batch size is meet.
898   * </p>
899   */
900  public PersistBatch getPersistBatch() {
901    return persistBatch;
902  }
903
904  /**
905   * Set the JDBC batch mode to use at the transaction level.
906   * <p>
907   * When INSERT or ALL is used then save(), delete() etc do not execute immediately but instead go into
908   * a JDBC batch execute buffer that is flushed. The buffer is flushed if a query is executed, transaction ends
909   * or the batch size is meet.
910   * </p>
911   */
912  public void setPersistBatch(PersistBatch persistBatch) {
913    this.persistBatch = persistBatch;
914  }
915
916  /**
917   * Return the JDBC batch mode to use per save(), delete(), insert() or update() request.
918   * <p>
919   * This makes sense when a save() or delete() cascades and executes multiple child statements. The best case
920   * for this is when saving a master/parent bean this cascade inserts many detail/child beans.
921   * </p>
922   * <p>
923   * This only takes effect when the persistBatch mode at the transaction level does not take effect.
924   * </p>
925   */
926  public PersistBatch getPersistBatchOnCascade() {
927    return persistBatchOnCascade;
928  }
929
930  /**
931   * Set the JDBC batch mode to use per save(), delete(), insert() or update() request.
932   * <p>
933   * This makes sense when a save() or delete() etc cascades and executes multiple child statements. The best caase
934   * for this is when saving a master/parent bean this cascade inserts many detail/child beans.
935   * </p>
936   * <p>
937   * This only takes effect when the persistBatch mode at the transaction level does not take effect.
938   * </p>
939   */
940  public void setPersistBatchOnCascade(PersistBatch persistBatchOnCascade) {
941    this.persistBatchOnCascade = persistBatchOnCascade;
942  }
943
944  /**
945   * Deprecated, please migrate to using setPersistBatch().
946   * <p>
947   * Set to true if you what to use JDBC batching for persisting and deleting
948   * beans.
949   * </p>
950   * <p>
951   * With this Ebean will batch up persist requests and use the JDBC batch api.
952   * This is a performance optimisation designed to reduce the network chatter.
953   * </p>
954   * <p>
955   * When true this is equivalent to {@code setPersistBatch(PersistBatch.ALL)} or
956   * when false to {@code setPersistBatch(PersistBatch.NONE)}
957   * </p>
958   */
959  public void setPersistBatching(boolean persistBatching) {
960    this.persistBatch = (persistBatching) ? PersistBatch.ALL : PersistBatch.NONE;
961  }
962
963  /**
964   * Return the batch size used for JDBC batching. This defaults to 20.
965   */
966  public int getPersistBatchSize() {
967    return persistBatchSize;
968  }
969
970  /**
971   * Set the batch size used for JDBC batching. If unset this defaults to 20.
972   * <p>
973   * You can also set the batch size on the transaction.
974   * </p>
975   *
976   * @see Transaction#setBatchSize(int)
977   */
978  public void setPersistBatchSize(int persistBatchSize) {
979    this.persistBatchSize = persistBatchSize;
980  }

1037   * <p>
1038   * The default value is for this is 10 (load 10 beans or collections).

1545   * If none is set the default UnderscoreNamingConvention is used.

1552  /**
1553   * Return true if all DB column and table names should use quoted identifiers.
1554   */
1555  public boolean isAllQuotedIdentifiers() {
1556    return platformConfig.isAllQuotedIdentifiers();
1557  }
1558
1559  /**
1560   * Set to true if all DB column and table names should use quoted identifiers.
1561   */
1562  public void setAllQuotedIdentifiers(boolean allQuotedIdentifiers) {
1563    platformConfig.setAllQuotedIdentifiers(allQuotedIdentifiers);
1564    if (allQuotedIdentifiers) {
1565      adjustNamingConventionForAllQuoted();
1566    }
1567  }
1568
1569  private void adjustNamingConventionForAllQuoted() {
1570    if (namingConvention instanceof UnderscoreNamingConvention) {
1571      // we need to use matching naming convention
1572      this.namingConvention = new MatchingNamingConvention();
1573    }
1574  }

1657   * for explicit commit (or rollback).
1658   * </p>
1659   * <p>

1791  /**
1792   * Return the number of DB sequence values that should be preallocated.
1793   */
1794  public int getDatabaseSequenceBatchSize() {
1795    return platformConfig.getDatabaseSequenceBatchSize();
1796  }
1797
1798  /**
1799   * Set the number of DB sequence values that should be preallocated and cached
1800   * by Ebean.
1801   * <p>
1802   * This is only used for DB's that use sequences and is a performance
1803   * optimisation. This reduces the number of times Ebean needs to get a
1804   * sequence value from the Database reducing network chatter.
1805   * </p>
1806   * <p>
1807   * By default this value is 10 so when we need another Id (and don't have one
1808   * in our cache) Ebean will fetch 10 id's from the database. Note that when
1809   * the cache drops to have full (which is 5 by default) Ebean will fetch
1810   * another batch of Id's in a background thread.
1811   * </p>
1812   */
1813  public void setDatabaseSequenceBatch(int databaseSequenceBatchSize) {
1814    this.platformConfig.setDatabaseSequenceBatchSize(databaseSequenceBatchSize);
1815  }

1836   * detected from the JDBC driver (possibly 3rd party JDBC driver). It is also
1837   * useful when you want to do offline DDL generation for a database platform
1838   * that you don't have access to.

1840   * <p>
1841   * Values are oracle, h2, postgres, mysql, sqlserver16, sqlserver17.

2022  /**
2023   * Return the UUID state file.
2024   */
2025  public String getUuidStateFile() {
2026    if (uuidStateFile == null || uuidStateFile.isEmpty()) {
2027      // by default, add servername...
2028      uuidStateFile = name + "-uuid.state";
2029      // and store it in the user's home directory
2030      String homeDir = System.getProperty("user.home");
2031      if (homeDir != null && homeDir.isEmpty()) {
2032        uuidStateFile = homeDir + "/.ebean/" + uuidStateFile;
2033      }
2034    }
2035    return uuidStateFile;
2036  }
2037
2038  /**
2039   * Set the UUID state file.
2040   */
2041  public void setUuidStateFile(String uuidStateFile) {
2042    this.uuidStateFile = uuidStateFile;
2043  }

2229  /**
2230   * Programmatically add classes (typically entities) that this server should
2231   * use.
2232   * <p>
2233   * The class can be an Entity, Embedded type, ScalarType, BeanPersistListener,
2234   * BeanFinder or BeanPersistController.
2235   * </p>

2237   * If no classes are specified then the classes are found automatically via
2238   * searching the class path.
2239   * </p>
2240   * <p>
2241   * Alternatively the classes can be added via {@link #setClasses(List)}.
2242   * </p>
2243   *
2244   * @param cls the entity type (or other type) that should be registered by this
2245   *            database.
2246   */
2247  public void addClass(Class<?> cls) {
2248    classes.add(cls);
2249  }

2252   * Register all the classes (typically entity classes).
2253   */
2254  public void addAll(List<Class<?>> classList) {
2255    if (classList != null && !classList.isEmpty()) {
2256      classes.addAll(classList);
2257    }
2258  }

2312
2313  /**
2314   * Return true if L2 bean cache should be skipped once writes have occurred on a transaction.
2315   * <p>
2316   * This defaults to true and means that for "find by id" and "find by natural key"
2317   * queries that normally hit L2 bean cache automatically will not do so after a write/persist
2318   * on the transaction.
2319   * </p>
2320   * <p>
2321   * <pre>{@code
2322   *
2323   *   // assume Customer has L2 bean caching enabled ...
2324   *
2325   *   try (Transaction transaction = DB.beginTransaction()) {
2326   *
2327   *     // this uses L2 bean cache as the transaction
2328   *     // ... is considered "query only" at this point
2329   *     Customer.find.byId(42);
2330   *
2331   *     // transaction no longer "query only" once
2332   *     // ... a bean has been saved etc
2333   *     DB.save(someBean);
2334   *
2335   *     // will NOT use L2 bean cache as the transaction
2336   *     // ... is no longer considered "query only"
2337   *     Customer.find.byId(55);
2338   *
2339   *
2340   *
2341   *     // explicit control - please use L2 bean cache
2342   *
2343   *     transaction.setSkipCache(false);
2344   *     Customer.find.byId(77); // hit the l2 bean cache
2345   *
2346   *
2347   *     // explicit control - please don't use L2 bean cache
2348   *
2349   *     transaction.setSkipCache(true);
2350   *     Customer.find.byId(99); // skips l2 bean cache
2351   *
2352   *   }
2353   *
2354   * }</pre>
2355   *
2356   * @see Transaction#setSkipCache(boolean)
2357   */
2358  public boolean isSkipCacheAfterWrite() {
2359    return skipCacheAfterWrite;
2360  }
2361
2362  /**
2363   * Set to false when we still want to hit the cache after a write has occurred on a transaction.
2364   */
2365  public void setSkipCacheAfterWrite(boolean skipCacheAfterWrite) {
2366    this.skipCacheAfterWrite = skipCacheAfterWrite;
2367  }
2368

2402  /**
2403   * Add a custom type mapping.
2404   * <p>
2405   * <pre>{@code
2406   *
2407   *   // set the default mapping for BigDecimal.class/decimal
2408   *   serverConfig.addCustomMapping(DbType.DECIMAL, "decimal(18,6)");
2409   *
2410   *   // set the default mapping for String.class/varchar but only for Postgres
2411   *   serverConfig.addCustomMapping(DbType.VARCHAR, "text", Platform.POSTGRES);
2412   *
2413   * }</pre>
2414   *
2415   * @param type             The DB type this mapping should apply to
2416   * @param columnDefinition The column definition that should be used
2417   * @param platform         Optionally specify the platform this mapping should apply to.
2418   */
2419  public void addCustomMapping(DbType type, String columnDefinition, Platform platform) {
2420    platformConfig.addCustomMapping(type, columnDefinition, platform);
2421  }
2422
2423  /**
2424   * Add a custom type mapping that applies to all platforms.
2425   * <p>
2426   * <pre>{@code
2427   *
2428   *   // set the default mapping for BigDecimal/decimal
2429   *   serverConfig.addCustomMapping(DbType.DECIMAL, "decimal(18,6)");
2430   *
2431   *   // set the default mapping for String/varchar
2432   *   serverConfig.addCustomMapping(DbType.VARCHAR, "text");
2433   *
2434   * }</pre>
2435   *
2436   * @param type             The DB type this mapping should apply to
2437   * @param columnDefinition The column definition that should be used
2438   */
2439  public void addCustomMapping(DbType type, String columnDefinition) {
2440    platformConfig.addCustomMapping(type, columnDefinition);
2441  }

2643  /**
2644   * Return the default PersistenceContextScope to be used if one is not explicitly set on a query.
2645   * <p/>

2647   * .Query#setPersistenceContextScope(io.ebean.PersistenceContextScope)}. If it

2649   *

2651   */

2688  /**
2689   * Return the service loader using the classLoader defined in ClassLoadConfig.
2690   */
2691  public <T> ServiceLoader<T> serviceLoad(Class<T> spiService) {
2692
2693    return ServiceLoader.load(spiService, classLoadConfig.getClassLoader());
2694  }
2695
2696  /**
2697   * Return the first service using the service loader (or null).
2698   */
2699  public <T> T service(Class<T> spiService) {
2700    ServiceLoader<T> load = serviceLoad(spiService);
2701    Iterator<T> serviceInstances = load.iterator();
2702    return serviceInstances.hasNext() ? serviceInstances.next() : null;
2703  }
2704
2705  /**
2706   * Load settings from ebean.properties.
2707   */
2708  public void loadFromProperties() {
2709    this.properties = Config.asProperties();
2710    configureFromProperties();
2711  }
2712
2713  /**
2714   * Load the settings from the given properties
2715   */
2716  public void loadFromProperties(Properties properties) {
2717    // keep the properties used for configuration so that these are available for plugins
2718    this.properties = Config.asConfiguration().eval(properties);
2719    configureFromProperties();
2720  }
2721
2722  /**
2723   * Load the settings from the given properties
2724   */
2725  private void configureFromProperties() {
2726    List<AutoConfigure> autoConfigures = autoConfiguration();
2727    loadSettings(new PropertiesWrapper("ebean", name, properties, classLoadConfig));
2728    for (AutoConfigure autoConfigure : autoConfigures) {
2729      autoConfigure.postConfigure(this);
2730    }
2731  }
2732
2733  /**
2734   * Use a 'plugin' to provide automatic configuration. Intended for automatic testing
2735   * configuration with Docker containers via ebean-test-config.
2736   */
2737  private List<AutoConfigure> autoConfiguration() {
2738    List<AutoConfigure> list = new ArrayList<>();
2739    for (AutoConfigure autoConfigure : serviceLoad(AutoConfigure.class)) {
2740      autoConfigure.preConfigure(this);
2741      list.add(autoConfigure);
2742    }
2743    return list;
2744  }
2745
2746  /**
2747   * Return the properties that we used for configuration and were set via a call to loadFromProperties().
2748   */
2749  public Properties getProperties() {
2750    return properties;
2751  }
2752
2753  /**
2754   * loads the data source settings to preserve existing behaviour. IMHO, if someone has set the datasource config already,
2755   * they don't want the settings to be reloaded and reset. This allows a descending class to override this behaviour and prevent it
2756   * from happening.
2757   *
2758   * @param p - The defined property source passed to load settings
2759   */
2760  protected void loadDataSourceSettings(PropertiesWrapper p) {
2761    dataSourceConfig.loadSettings(p.properties, name);
2762    readOnlyDataSourceConfig.loadSettings(p.properties, name + "-ro");
2763  }
2764
2765  /**
2766   * This is broken out to allow overridden behaviour.
2767   */
2768  protected void loadDocStoreSettings(PropertiesWrapper p) {
2769    docStoreConfig.loadSettings(p);
2770  }
2771
2772  /**
2773   * This is broken out to allow overridden behaviour.
2774   */
2775  protected void loadAutoTuneSettings(PropertiesWrapper p) {
2776    autoTuneConfig.loadSettings(p);
2777  }
2778
2779  /**
2780   * Load the configuration settings from the properties file.
2781   */
2782  protected void loadSettings(PropertiesWrapper p) {
2783
2784    dbSchema = p.get("dbSchema", dbSchema);
2785    if (dbSchema != null) {
2786      migrationConfig.setDefaultDbSchema(dbSchema);
2787    }
2788    profilingConfig.loadSettings(p, name);
2789    migrationConfig.loadSettings(p, name);
2790    platformConfig.loadSettings(p);
2791    if (platformConfig.isAllQuotedIdentifiers()) {
2792      adjustNamingConventionForAllQuoted();
2793    }
2794    namingConvention = createNamingConvention(p, namingConvention);
2795    if (namingConvention != null) {
2796      namingConvention.loadFromProperties(p);
2797    }
2798    if (autoTuneConfig == null) {
2799      autoTuneConfig = new AutoTuneConfig();
2800    }
2801    loadAutoTuneSettings(p);
2802
2803    if (dataSourceConfig == null) {
2804      dataSourceConfig = new DataSourceConfig();
2805    }
2806    loadDataSourceSettings(p);
2807
2808    if (docStoreConfig == null) {
2809      docStoreConfig = new DocStoreConfig();
2810    }
2811    loadDocStoreSettings(p);
2812
2813    loadModuleInfo = p.getBoolean("loadModuleInfo", loadModuleInfo);
2814    maxCallStack = p.getInt("maxCallStack", maxCallStack);
2815    dumpMetricsOnShutdown = p.getBoolean("dumpMetricsOnShutdown", dumpMetricsOnShutdown);
2816    dumpMetricsOptions = p.get("dumpMetricsOptions", dumpMetricsOptions);
2817    queryPlanTTLSeconds = p.getInt("queryPlanTTLSeconds", queryPlanTTLSeconds);
2818    slowQueryMillis = p.getLong("slowQueryMillis", slowQueryMillis);
2819    collectQueryPlans = p.getBoolean("collectQueryPlans", collectQueryPlans);
2820    collectQueryPlanThresholdMicros = p.getLong("collectQueryPlanThresholdMicros", collectQueryPlanThresholdMicros);
2821    docStoreOnly = p.getBoolean("docStoreOnly", docStoreOnly);
2822    disableL2Cache = p.getBoolean("disableL2Cache", disableL2Cache);
2823    localOnlyL2Cache = p.getBoolean("localOnlyL2Cache", localOnlyL2Cache);
2824    enabledL2Regions = p.get("enabledL2Regions", enabledL2Regions);
2825    notifyL2CacheInForeground = p.getBoolean("notifyL2CacheInForeground", notifyL2CacheInForeground);
2826    useJtaTransactionManager = p.getBoolean("useJtaTransactionManager", useJtaTransactionManager);
2827    useJavaxValidationNotNull = p.getBoolean("useJavaxValidationNotNull", useJavaxValidationNotNull);
2828    autoReadOnlyDataSource = p.getBoolean("autoReadOnlyDataSource", autoReadOnlyDataSource);
2829    idGeneratorAutomatic = p.getBoolean("idGeneratorAutomatic", idGeneratorAutomatic);
2830
2831    backgroundExecutorSchedulePoolSize = p.getInt("backgroundExecutorSchedulePoolSize", backgroundExecutorSchedulePoolSize);
2832    backgroundExecutorShutdownSecs = p.getInt("backgroundExecutorShutdownSecs", backgroundExecutorShutdownSecs);
2833    disableClasspathSearch = p.getBoolean("disableClasspathSearch", disableClasspathSearch);
2834    currentUserProvider = p.createInstance(CurrentUserProvider.class, "currentUserProvider", currentUserProvider);
2835    databasePlatform = p.createInstance(DatabasePlatform.class, "databasePlatform", databasePlatform);
2836    encryptKeyManager = p.createInstance(EncryptKeyManager.class, "encryptKeyManager", encryptKeyManager);
2837    encryptDeployManager = p.createInstance(EncryptDeployManager.class, "encryptDeployManager", encryptDeployManager);
2838    encryptor = p.createInstance(Encryptor.class, "encryptor", encryptor);
2839    dbEncrypt = p.createInstance(DbEncrypt.class, "dbEncrypt", dbEncrypt);
2840    dbOffline = p.getBoolean("dbOffline", dbOffline);
2841    serverCachePlugin = p.createInstance(ServerCachePlugin.class, "serverCachePlugin", serverCachePlugin);
2842
2843    String packagesProp = p.get("search.packages", p.get("packages", null));
2844    packages = getSearchList(packagesProp, packages);
2845
2846    skipCacheAfterWrite = p.getBoolean("skipCacheAfterWrite", skipCacheAfterWrite);
2847    updateAllPropertiesInBatch = p.getBoolean("updateAllPropertiesInBatch", updateAllPropertiesInBatch);
2848
2849    if (p.get("batch.mode") != null || p.get("persistBatching") != null) {
2850      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Property 'batch.mode' or 'persistBatching' is being set but no longer used. Please change to use 'persistBatchMode'");
2851    }
2852
2853    persistBatch = p.getEnum(PersistBatch.class, "persistBatch", persistBatch);
2854    persistBatchOnCascade = p.getEnum(PersistBatch.class, "persistBatchOnCascade", persistBatchOnCascade);
2855
2856    int batchSize = p.getInt("batch.size", persistBatchSize);
2857    persistBatchSize = p.getInt("persistBatchSize", batchSize);
2858
2859    persistenceContextScope = PersistenceContextScope.valueOf(p.get("persistenceContextScope", "TRANSACTION"));
2860
2861    changeLogAsync = p.getBoolean("changeLogAsync", changeLogAsync);
2862    changeLogIncludeInserts = p.getBoolean("changeLogIncludeInserts", changeLogIncludeInserts);
2863    expressionEqualsWithNullAsNoop = p.getBoolean("expressionEqualsWithNullAsNoop", expressionEqualsWithNullAsNoop);
2864    expressionNativeIlike = p.getBoolean("expressionNativeIlike", expressionNativeIlike);
2865
2866    dataTimeZone = p.get("dataTimeZone", dataTimeZone);
2867    asOfViewSuffix = p.get("asOfViewSuffix", asOfViewSuffix);
2868    asOfSysPeriod = p.get("asOfSysPeriod", asOfSysPeriod);
2869    historyTableSuffix = p.get("historyTableSuffix", historyTableSuffix);
2870    dataSourceJndiName = p.get("dataSourceJndiName", dataSourceJndiName);
2871    jdbcFetchSizeFindEach = p.getInt("jdbcFetchSizeFindEach", jdbcFetchSizeFindEach);
2872    jdbcFetchSizeFindList = p.getInt("jdbcFetchSizeFindList", jdbcFetchSizeFindList);
2873    databasePlatformName = p.get("databasePlatformName", databasePlatformName);
2874    defaultOrderById = p.getBoolean("defaultOrderById", defaultOrderById);
2875
2876    uuidVersion = p.getEnum(UuidVersion.class, "uuidVersion", uuidVersion);
2877    uuidStateFile = p.get("uuidStateFile", uuidStateFile);
2878
2879    localTimeWithNanos = p.getBoolean("localTimeWithNanos", localTimeWithNanos);
2880    jodaLocalTimeMode = p.get("jodaLocalTimeMode", jodaLocalTimeMode);
2881
2882    defaultEnumType = p.getEnum(EnumType.class, "defaultEnumType", defaultEnumType);
2883    disableLazyLoading = p.getBoolean("disableLazyLoading", disableLazyLoading);
2884    lazyLoadBatchSize = p.getInt("lazyLoadBatchSize", lazyLoadBatchSize);
2885    queryBatchSize = p.getInt("queryBatchSize", queryBatchSize);
2886
2887    jsonInclude = p.getEnum(JsonConfig.Include.class, "jsonInclude", jsonInclude);
2888    jsonDateTime = p.getEnum(JsonConfig.DateTime.class, "jsonDateTime", jsonDateTime);
2889    jsonDate = p.getEnum(JsonConfig.Date.class, "jsonDate", jsonDate);
2890
2891    ddlGenerate = p.getBoolean("ddl.generate", ddlGenerate);
2892    ddlRun = p.getBoolean("ddl.run", ddlRun);
2893    ddlExtra = p.getBoolean("ddl.extra", ddlExtra);
2894    ddlCreateOnly = p.getBoolean("ddl.createOnly", ddlCreateOnly);
2895    ddlInitSql = p.get("ddl.initSql", ddlInitSql);
2896    ddlSeedSql = p.get("ddl.seedSql", ddlSeedSql);
2897
2898    // read tenant-configuration from config:
2899    // tenant.mode = NONE | DB | SCHEMA | CATALOG | PARTITION
2900    String mode = p.get("tenant.mode");
2901    if (mode != null) {
2902      for (TenantMode value : TenantMode.values()) {
2903        if (value.name().equalsIgnoreCase(mode)) {
2904          tenantMode = value;
2905          break;
2906        }
2907      }
2908    }
2909
2910    currentTenantProvider = p.createInstance(CurrentTenantProvider.class, "tenant.currentTenantProvider", currentTenantProvider);
2911    tenantCatalogProvider = p.createInstance(TenantCatalogProvider.class, "tenant.catalogProvider", tenantCatalogProvider);
2912    tenantSchemaProvider = p.createInstance(TenantSchemaProvider.class, "tenant.schemaProvider", tenantSchemaProvider);
2913    tenantPartitionColumn = p.get("tenant.partitionColumn", tenantPartitionColumn);
2914    classes = getClasses(p);
2915
2916    String mappingsProp = p.get("mappingLocations", null);
2917    mappingLocations = getSearchList(mappingsProp, mappingLocations);
2918  }
2919
2920  private NamingConvention createNamingConvention(PropertiesWrapper properties, NamingConvention namingConvention) {
2921    NamingConvention nc = properties.createInstance(NamingConvention.class, "namingConvention", null);
2922    return (nc != null) ? nc : namingConvention;
2923  }
2924
2925  /**
2926   * Build the list of classes from the comma delimited string.
2927   *
2928   * @param properties the properties
2929   * @return the classes
2930   */
2931  private List<Class<?>> getClasses(PropertiesWrapper properties) {
2932
2933    String classNames = properties.get("classes", null);
2934    if (classNames == null) {
2935      return classes;
2936    }
2937
2938    List<Class<?>> classList = new ArrayList<>();
2939
2940    String[] split = StringHelper.splitNames(classNames);
2941    for (String cn : split) {
2942      if (!"class".equalsIgnoreCase(cn)) {
2943        try {
2944          classList.add(Class.forName(cn));
2945        } catch (ClassNotFoundException e) {
2946          String msg = "Error registering class [" + cn + "] from [" + classNames + "]";
2947          throw new RuntimeException(msg, e);
2948        }
2949      }
2950    }
2951    return classList;
2952  }
2953
2954  private List<String> getSearchList(String searchNames, List<String> defaultValue) {
2955
2956    if (searchNames != null) {
2957      String[] entries = StringHelper.splitNames(searchNames);
2958
2959      List<String> hitList = new ArrayList<>(entries.length);
2960      Collections.addAll(hitList, entries);
2961
2962      return hitList;
2963    } else {
2964      return defaultValue;
2965    }
2966  }
2967
2968  /**
2969   * Return the PersistBatch mode to use for 'batchOnCascade' taking into account if the database
2970   * platform supports getGeneratedKeys in batch mode.
2971   */
2972  public PersistBatch appliedPersistBatchOnCascade() {
2973
2974    if (persistBatchOnCascade == PersistBatch.INHERIT) {
2975      // use the platform default (ALL except SQL Server which has NONE)
2976      return databasePlatform.getPersistBatchOnCascade();
2977    }
2978    return persistBatchOnCascade;
2979  }

3001  /**
3002   * Return true if eq("someProperty", null) should to generate "1=1" rather than "is null" sql expression.
3003   */
3004  public boolean isExpressionEqualsWithNullAsNoop() {
3005    return expressionEqualsWithNullAsNoop;
3006  }
3007
3008  /**
3009   * Set to true if you want eq("someProperty", null) to generate "1=1" rather than "is null" sql expression.
3010   * <p>
3011   * Setting this to true has the effect that eq(propertyName, value), ieq(propertyName, value) and
3012   * ne(propertyName, value) have no effect when the value is null. The expression factory adds a NoopExpression
3013   * which will add "1=1" into the SQL rather than "is null".
3014   * </p>
3015   */
3016  public void setExpressionEqualsWithNullAsNoop(boolean expressionEqualsWithNullAsNoop) {
3017    this.expressionEqualsWithNullAsNoop = expressionEqualsWithNullAsNoop;
3018  }

3083  /**
3084   * Controls if Ebean should ignore <code>&x64;javax.validation.contstraints.NotNull</code>
3085   * with respect to generating a <code>NOT NULL</code> column.
3086   * <p>
3087   * Normally when Ebean sees javax NotNull annotation it means that column is defined as NOT NULL.
3088   * Set this to <code>false</code> and the javax NotNull annotation is effectively ignored (and
3089   * we instead use Ebean's own NotNull annotation or JPA Column(nullable=false) annotation.
3090   */
3091  public void setUseJavaxValidationNotNull(boolean useJavaxValidationNotNull) {
3092    this.useJavaxValidationNotNull = useJavaxValidationNotNull;
3093  }

3097   */
3098  public boolean isNotifyL2CacheInForeground() {
3099    return notifyL2CacheInForeground;
3100  }
3101
3102  /**
3103   * Set this to true to run L2 cache notification in the foreground.
3104   * <p>
3105   * In general we don't want to do that as when we use a distributed cache (like Ignite, Hazelcast etc)
3106   * we are making network calls and we prefer to do this in background and not impact the response time
3107   * of the executing transaction.
3108   * </p>
3109   */
3110  public void setNotifyL2CacheInForeground(boolean notifyL2CacheInForeground) {
3111    this.notifyL2CacheInForeground = notifyL2CacheInForeground;
3112  }

3128  /**
3129   * Run the DB migration against the DataSource.
3130   */
3131  public DataSource runDbMigration(DataSource dataSource) {
3132    if (migrationConfig.isRunMigration()) {
3133      MigrationRunner runner = migrationConfig.createRunner(getClassLoadConfig().getClassLoader(), properties);
3134      runner.run(dataSource);
3135    }
3136    return dataSource;
3137  }
3138
3139  /**
3140   * Create a new PlatformConfig based of the one held but with overridden properties by reading
3141   * properties with the given path and prefix.
3142   * <p>
3143   * Typically used in Db Migration generation for many platform targets that might have different
3144   * configuration for IdType, UUID, quoted identifiers etc.
3145   * </p>
3146   *
3147   * @param propertiesPath The properties path used for loading and setting properties
3148   * @param platformPrefix The prefix used for loading and setting properties
3149   * @return A copy of the PlatformConfig with overridden properties
3150   */
3151  public PlatformConfig newPlatformConfig(String propertiesPath, String platformPrefix) {
3152    if (properties == null) {
3153      properties = new Properties();
3154    }
3155    PropertiesWrapper p = new PropertiesWrapper(propertiesPath, platformPrefix, properties, classLoadConfig);
3156    PlatformConfig config = new PlatformConfig(platformConfig);
3157    config.loadSettings(p);
3158    return config;
3159  }

3165    if (mappingLocations == null) {
3166      mappingLocations = new ArrayList<>();
3167    }
3168    mappingLocations.add(mappingLocation);
3169  }

3263  /**
3264   * Return true if entity classes should be loaded and registered via ModuleInfoLoader.
3265   * <p>
3266   * When false we either register entity classes via application code or use classpath
3267   * scanning to find and register entity classes.
3268   * </p>
3269   */
3270  public boolean isAutoLoadModuleInfo() {
3271    return loadModuleInfo && classes.isEmpty();
3272  }
3273
3274  /**
3275   * Set false to turn off automatic registration of entity beans.
3276   * <p>
3277   * When using query beans that also generates a module info class that
3278   * can register the entity bean classes (to avoid classpath scanning).
3279   * This is on by default and setting this to false turns it off.
3280   */
3281  public void setLoadModuleInfo(boolean loadModuleInfo) {
3282    this.loadModuleInfo = loadModuleInfo;
3283  }
